hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils package¶

Submodules¶

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.dictutils module¶

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.dictutils.map_dict(map_function, dictionary)¶
Maps a dictionary to another by preserving keys and applying the given map

function to values keys point to

Parameters

  • map_function (V => A) – Function from V to A where V are values of dictionary and A is any type

  • dictionary (dict(K, V)) – Dictionary of keys of type K pointing to values of type V

Returns

Dictionary with keys same as the input dictionary, while each value is obtained by applying the given function to the value under particular key

Return type

dict(K, A)

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.numberutils module¶

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.numberutils.convert_to_float_array(arr, decimals_included)¶
The inverse function of convert_to_int_array function.

Converts a numpy array of type int into an array of type float under assumption that last decimals_included digits of each int number are their decimal digits in float representation.

Parameters

  • arr (np.array[int]) – Array to be converted

  • decimals_included (int) – Number of decimals included in int representation of array

Return type

np.array[float]

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.numberutils.convert_to_int_array(arr, decimals_included)¶
Converts a numpy array of type float into an array of type int while

preserving information about decimals_included decimals. It is not recommended to use array in this form for mathematical operations.

Parameters

  • arr (np.array[float]) – Array to be converted

  • decimals_included (int) – Number of decimals to be preserved

Return type

np.array[int]

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.secret_sharing module¶

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.secret_sharing.create_additive_shares(arr, num_shares)¶

Create additive int64 shares out of the passed int64 array

Parameters

  • arr (np.array[np.int64]) – Arrray to create shares out of

  • num_shares (int) – Number of shares to create

Returns

List of shares

Return type

list[np.array[np.int64]]

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.secret_sharing.create_int_additive_shares(number_to_split, num_shares)¶

Splits given number in specified number of additive shares

Parameters

  • number_to_split (np.int64) – Number to split

  • num_shares (int) – Number of shares that number_to_split should be split into

Returns

List of additive shares

Return type

list[np.int64]

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.secret_sharing.rand_interval(low, high, shape, sampler_function=<built-in method rand of numpy.random.mtrand.RandomState object>)¶
(Deprecated) Initializes array of the given shape with random values in

interval [low, high) sampled by sampler_function

Parameters

  • low (float) – Lower bound

  • high (float) – Upper bound

  • shape (list[int] or Tuple[int]) – Shape of the output

  • sampler_function ((*int) => np.array) – A function that accepts shape and returns a sample of the given size with each value being in the range [0, 1)

Returns

Array of specified shape

Return type

np.array

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.secret_sharing.reconstruct_additive_secretsharing_result(shares)¶

Returns sum of given additive shares

Parameters

shares (list[np.array]) – Shares

Returns

Sum of shares over axis 0

Return type

np.array

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.torchutils module¶

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.torchutils.convert_numpy_state_dict_to_torch(numpy_state_dict)¶
The inverse function of convert_state_dict_to_numpy.

Converts state dictionary from numpy form back to torch.tensor form.

Parameters

numpy_state_dict (dict(string, numpy.array)) – Analogue of PyTorch state_dict but instead of using tensors uses numpy arrays

Return type

dict(str, torch.tensor)

hyperaggregate.aggregation_profiles.impl.utils.torchutils.convert_state_dict_to_numpy(state_dict)¶
Converts each tensor of the state dictionary into the equivalent

numpy array.

Parameters

state_dict (dict(str, torch.tensor)) – collections.OrderedDict

Return type

dict(string, numpy.array)

Module contents¶

Helper functionality used to implement concrete aggregation profiles
